message: For those in need of some casual exercise, a few of us are going for a short (4 miles or less) run tomorrow morning at 6:30 am. We will meet in the lower lobby of the hotel.
What pace do you guys run at?
as additional incentive, while running this morning, we saw the bats returning to the Congress bridge. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_W._Richards_Congress_Avenue_Bridge#Bats
Depends on the group. Likely not fast (>9 min/mile), as we'd like to be as inclusive as possible.
Excuses, excuses.
Will try to get to bed earlier than 3 tonight :)
OK, that is around my pace, so I will be there.  Thanks for organizing this.
I'll bring my GPS, then we can map our route on Endomondo.com
This is a nice route too:http://enthoug.ht/oCJTsk — through campus and a pretty/historic neighborhood. But I'm up for the river bat tour as well...
There did not seem to be a route on the link you sent above, Amenity. Can you re-send? I am up for any of the options.
I'll be there. Is Pease Park (and the Shoal Creek Trail) realistic to run to?
Pease Park is pretty close, so it would not be very long. This was the original plan: http://bit.ly/o3ihvw
@fonnesbeck, it looks like it is ~5 miles, which is long enough for me, but I could always turn back after the park loop if others want to go further.
Oops, here: http://wjr.me/pnI46d
Thanks to everyone who came out this morning! Hopefully everyone made it back safely ...
Good run!
Awesome!
http://www.endomondo.com/workouts/qL-Cpr85xKc
Can't believe it took 6 speedy out-of-towners to finally show me the bats. Thanks guys!
What time did the bats return to the bridge? I see them often in the evening but never in the morning.
From Stéfan's GPS, I'm estimating we saw the bats at 6:46.
There was some casual interest in another run before the sprints tomorrow. Let me know if anyone is interested. We can make it shorter than today's.
